etymologies: 1930s; earliest use found in Chemical Review. From dihydro- + chalcone

definitions: A dihydro derivative of the compound chalcone; 1,3-diphenyl-propan-1-one, C₆ H₅ —CH₂ CH₂ CO—C₆ H₅.
Any of a group of flavonoids that are dihydro derivatives of chalcones, many of which occur in plants and some of which have an extremely sweet taste and are used in artificial sweeteners.
